definition: the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to fly
moth
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.chinese: 我祈禱着飛蛾撲火的毀滅。

sentences.english: I love your fire like moths irresistible.
sentences.chinese: 我對你的愛就像飛蛾撲火不可抗拒。

sentences.english: A moth, a few people can do.
sentences.chinese: 飛蛾撲火，有幾人能做到。

sentences.english: If you'er the rock, i still crush against.
sentences.chinese: 即使你心如磐石，我仍願飛蛾撲火。

sentences.english: I can't predict where it ends, if you are the rock I'll crush against.
sentences.chinese: 縱使結局無法預料，我仍舊甘願飛蛾撲火。

definition: reckless/regardless of everything
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
indecisive/wavering
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
to force someone to do something
to work to no avail (idiom)
downhearted/downcast/in despair
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
affectionate/an affectionate person
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
